statement.tex: \text{If $\ora{a}=\vector{1}{1}{1}$ and $\ora{b}=\vector{}{1}{-1}$, find a} \\ \text{vector $\ora{c}$, such that $\ora{a}\times \ora{c}=\ora{b}$ and} \\ \ora{a}\cdot \ora{c}=3.

step.reason: \ora{a}=\vector{1}{1}{1}, \ora{b}=\vector{}{1}{-1} \text{ and } \\ \ora{c}=\vector{c_1}{c_2}{c_3}. \\ \begin{align} \text{Now, }&{\bf \ora{a}\times \ora{c}=\ora{b}} \\ \implies & \left\vert\begin{array}{ccc} i & j & k \\ 1 & 1 & 1 \\ c_1 & c_2 & c_3 \end{array}\right\vert=\vector{}{1}{-1} \\ \implies&\vector{(c_3-c_2)}{-(c_3-c_1)}{(c_2-c_1)}=\vector{}{1}{-1} \\ \implies & c_3-c_2=0, c_1=1+c_3, c_1=1+c_2 \end{align} \\ \therefore {\bf c_3=c_2=c_1-1}

c_3=c_2=c_1-1 \text{ and } c_1+c_2+c_3=3 \\ \implies c_1+c_1-1+c_1-1=3 \\ \implies 3c_1=5 \implies c_1=\dfrac{5}{3} \\ \therefore c_2=c_3=\dfrac{2}{3} \\ \therefore \ora{c}=\dfrac{1}{3}\left(\vector{5}{2}{2}\right)
